items.title: The Pocket AIR Mini has forever raised my expectations for budget gaming handhelds
items.summary: AYANEO's first sub-$100 gaming handheld sets a new bar for affordable devices.
items.body: AYANEO has been synonymous with premium gaming handhelds for years, so when it announced the sub-$100 Pocket AIR Mini, it immediately caught my attention. This is by far the cheapest device the company offers, but what corners did it cut to hit this price point? After testing the device, Iâ€™m happy to say that it sacrifices surprisingly little. Itâ€™s easily one of the best options when it comes to entry-level handhelds, with a level of performance that outshines everything in its price bracket.

items.title: England in tatters after dismal day in Brisbane
items.summary: Englandâ€™s hopes in the second Test - and the Ashes - are in tatters after a dismal and depressing third day in Brisbane.

items.title: Brook overturns shocking dismissal before being given out next ball
items.summary: Harry Brook uses a review to overturn a caught behind dismissal before being given out by the video umpire the very next ball as England fall to 123-5 on day three of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: England needed to show more fight - Vaughan
items.summary: England failed to show fight in the final session of the third day of the Ashes Test, said former captain Michael Vaughan.

items.title: Survey reveals many Pixel owners are using the wrong Qi or Qi2 charger for their phone
items.summary: Users are getting 5W of wireless charging instead of 10-15W by opting for the wrong charger for their Pixel.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Wireless charging has never been a straightforward matter on Pixels, with many recent phones claiming two different speeds whether you were using the official Pixel Stand or a third-party charger. With the Pixel 10 series shipping out of the box with built-in Qi2 and Qi2 25W , we thought things would finally be standardized and that we wouldnâ€™t have to think about which charger weâ€™re using with which phone. Alas, that is far from the truth. Iâ€™ve conducted many tests over the past few months and discovered that there are intricate differences between older Pixels and newer ones, and how each of them adapts to different wireless chargers. The takeaway? Itâ€™s easy to buy the wrong charger for your phone and, as our surveys have revealed, many of you have fallen for that trap. Hereâ€™s what I found out and why thatâ€™s wrong.

items.title: Prepaid cellular is rising while postpaid value declines, so should the big 3 worry?
items.summary: Prepaid might be on the rise, but postpaid remains the profit engine for the big 3 and that won't change anytime soon.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority Most countries rely heavily on prepaid services as opposed to postpaid services, but the United States has long been an exception. That balance is slowly changing in the US as prepaid adoption is rising while postpaid growth has stalled or even slipped in some cases. The main driver is customer frustration with steady price escalations, including fee hikes, smaller autopay discounts, and direct plan increases. For example, Verizon recently cut its myPlan autopay discount from ten dollars to five dollars, and all three major carriers have raised their infrastructure fees. T-Mobile also stopped including taxes and fees in its advertised pricing. I have argued before that prepaid is now the better choice for many consumers. The real questions are what caused this shift, whether it could have been avoided, and how worried the big three should be about prepaid competitors.

items.title: Still donâ€™t have Gemini on your Google Home speaker? Hereâ€™s how to get it
items.summary: If your speaker is stuck on Google Assistant, you've come to the right place.
items.body: In late October, Google officially began its big rollout of Gemini for Google Home . Google Assistant hasnâ€™t been doing Googleâ€™s smart speakers and displays any favors in recent years, so the transition to Gemini has been long-awaited. Thereâ€™s just one problem. Although Gemini for Google Home started rolling out on October 28, it looks like many Google Home users havenâ€™t received the update yet â€” myself included. My Google Nest Hub has been stuck on Google Assistant, or at least it was up until a couple of days ago.

items.title: 'It's a shocker!' - Pope and Crawley both out caught & bowled
items.summary: Ollie Pope and Zak Crawley are both caught and bowled by Michael Neser as England slump to 97-3 on day three of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: 'Top quality' Bell settling in at Ulster - Murphy
items.summary: Head coach Richie Murphy feels the province will soon "see the blessing" of Angus Bell's arrival at Ulster.

items.title: Unpopular opinion: Google shouldnâ€™t build Aluminum OS
items.summary: Maybe Google should fix Android on big screens first.
items.body: The Android side of the internet is abuzz with rumors around Googleâ€™s Aluminum OS , which is expected to replace ChromeOS on low-power laptops. That sounds like an incredible idea since Google hasnâ€™t had its own real computer software in forever â€” no, ChromeOS doesnâ€™t count for real work â€” and has relied on Windows (and now even Mac) for interoperability between Android phones/tablets and other platforms. When Google is putting in so much effort to make Android apps interoperable â€” from letting you play Android games on Windows to making Pixel 10s work with Apple AirDrop (you know, the existing desktop ecosystem) â€” isnâ€™t this the better direction to put your energy into instead of creating a new OS from scratch?

items.title: The worldâ€™s first Android 16 e-reader just got colorful
items.summary: The AiPaper Reader C brings color and connectivity to the minimalist reader.
items.body: TL;DR ViWoods launched the new Android 16-powered AiPaper Reader C, with a colorful E Ink display. The Reader C keeps the same compact build, data-only SIM card support, and dedicated AI button. Priced at $349, it is available now through ViWoods and third-party retailers like Amazon. Just weeks after we covered ViWoodsâ€™ unexpectedly ambitious AiPaper Reader, the worldâ€™s first reader running Android 16 , the company is already expanding the lineup. This time, itâ€™s adding a splash of color with the AiPaper Reader C, a variant that trades the crisp monochrome Carta panel for a color E Ink display. Itâ€™s a trendy pivot, as more and more e-readers get colorful makeovers throughout the market. The move to color should make the Reader C more appealing to anyone who regularly handles comics, illustrated books, childrenâ€™s titles, or PDFs with charts and diagrams. Color E Ink still isnâ€™t vibrant in the LCD sense, but it does add context that grayscale canâ€™t always capture. As always, a color E Ink panel also reduces sharpness, meaning text and fine lines wonâ€™t look as crisp as they do on the monochrome AiPaper Reader.

items.title: Boland bowls Duckett as ball stays very low
items.summary: Scott Boland dismisses Ben Duckett for 15 runs as the ball keeps low before hitting the stumps to leave England on 48-1 on day three of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: Cummins 'good to go' for third Ashes Test
items.summary: Australia captain Pat Cummins says he will be "good to go" for the third Ashes Test against England after recovering from injury.

items.title: Barmy Army go wild as England avoid losing wicket in first over

items.title: 'Vibes of Johnson' - Starc continues to 'break England hearts'
items.summary: Mitchell Starc dominates with bat and ball to put Australia in control of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

items.title: 'I have to get it right, and not just for me' - UFC trailblazer Sanko

items.title: Durant hits 31,000-point mark as Rockets beat Suns

items.title: A mysterious YouTube Music glitch is leaving offline songs unplayable
items.summary: The cause of the issue is unclear, and users are frustrated.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Some YouTube Music Premium users say downloaded tracks wonâ€™t play and get stuck loading, while streaming still works. Complaints on Googleâ€™s support forum and Reddit indicate that the issue occurs only on Android devices. Thereâ€™s no fix yet, and TeamYouTube has asked people to submit feedback. Just as the time for holiday playlists to be finalized approaches, some YouTube Music Premium listeners say their downloaded tracks have suddenly stopped working. Offline songs that played normally a few days ago are now stuck on a loading spinner, even though streaming the same tracks works without issue. PiunikaWeb spotted the growing number of complaints across Googleâ€™s support forums and Reddit. On the support forum, one Galaxy S24 Ultra user says they tried everything from clearing cache and data to rolling back to an older version, but playback still breaks the moment they download anything. Two other forum posters report the same thing, with one noting that disabling downloads entirely is the only way music will play.

items.title: Google might Venmo you a couple bucks this spring in Play Store settlement
items.summary: Google's $700 million settlement might buy you a cup of coffee next year.
items.body: TL;DR Google settled a lawsuit over monopolizing Android app distribution for $700 million in 2023. Payouts should start this spring, with affected users eligible for at least $2 via Venmo or PayPal. Payouts will mostly be automatic, but users who canâ€™t receive automatic payments have other options. A couple of years ago, Google settled a lawsuit brought by US states that accused the company of holding an illegal monopoly on Android app distribution, using its position to overcharge users for apps and in-app purchases. Despite Google denying wrongdoing, that settlement is set to pay out $700 million this spring. If youâ€™re owed a cut, you probably donâ€™t have to do much to get it. As reported today by ZDNET , settlement payments are on track to be distributed soon after a fairness hearing scheduled for April 30 of next year. Owners of Google accounts in all 50 states, Washington DC, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands who made purchases on the Play Store between 2016 and 2023 are included in the settlement. Payments should be distributed automatically.

items.title: Google Play Books is turning 15, and you can get bonus Play Points to celebrate
items.summary: Here's how you can earn 15x Google Play Points for a limited time.
items.body: TL;DR Google Play Books is turning 15 this weekend following its inception in 2010 and rebrand in 2012. To celebrate, Google is giving away 15x Play Points on Play Books purchases through December 7. Thatâ€™s a reward of 15 points per dollar spent for every Play Points user on any level. Googleâ€™s Play Store is known for being the official Android app marketplace, but the Play Store is also the home for buying movies, TV shows, books, and more. Google Play Books has become a great source for buying e-books, and itâ€™s one of our favorite e-book storefronts on Android. The Google Play Books platform is turning 15 this weekend, and book-lovers on Android get to celebrate the milestone with a major Play Points offer. In a blog post, Google announced that every Google Play Points user can earn bonus Play Points on any e-book purchase this weekend, spanning December 5 to December 7. Specifically, theyâ€™ll get 15 times the normal Play Points rewards for every Play Books purchase across the three-day window. The 15x Play Points promo is an obvious nod to Play Booksâ€™ birthday, and itâ€™s a great way to stock up on rewards points while padding your e-book collection in the process.

items.body: TL;DR Gemini for Home is admitting a second wave of users into the early access program this week as beta testing continues. The early access program is still limited to US homes and requires version 4.1 or higher of the Google Home app. Gemini is slowly replacing Google Assistant on all Google smart speakers and displays released since 2016. Gemini is slowly replacing Google Assistant throughout Googleâ€™s smart home ecosystem, initially for beta testers enrolled in an early access program. The first wave of the Gemini for Home rollout opened up on October 28 for users signed up for early access in the US. However, after that initial wave, most users appeared to be left waiting for entry. We asked readers in early November if they gained access to the Gemini for Home beta in a poll , and 88% of respondents said they hadnâ€™t. If youâ€™re waiting for access, thereâ€™s good news â€” Google appears to be letting more people into the Gemini for Home beta in what could be the second wave of the rollout. Weâ€™ve heard from multiple users who gained access to Gemini for Home recently, and some of Android Authorityâ€™s devices were upgraded to Gemini as well.

items.title: This popular carrier will soon offer an all-inclusive membership with flagship hardware and more
items.summary: One of the best prepaid networks is promising an even better all-inclusive package, but is it too good to be true?
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR US Mobileâ€™s CEO announced that the company activated over 30,000 new lines during Black Friday and confirmed plans to eventually roll out home internet service. Even better, he teased a new, ambitious membership program. Reportedly, the all-in-one membership program will include a flagship phone, multi-network uncapped premium data, a global number with international data, device protection, enhanced support perks, and more. US Mobile opened a waiting list for the program and noted that availability may be limited, with final details and pricing still unknown. US Mobile is known for great service, great pricing, and support for all three major US networks. If weâ€™re being honest, itâ€™s also known semi-regular stream of posts from the CEO that hint about whatâ€™s coming down the pipeline. After concluding its successful Black Friday promotion and activating over 30,000 new lines, Founder and CEO Ahmed Khattak has released his latest message to the fans via the companyâ€™s Reddit community page . This time, he thanked his users, boasted about growth, and promised an eventual rollout of home internet services. More significantly, he hinted â€¦

items.title: This tiny e-reader wants to hitch a ride on the back of your Pixel 10
items.summary: Xteink bets on portability instead of premium perks.
items.body: TL;DR Xteink has launched the X4, a tiny e-reader that magnetically attaches to your phone. It skips premium features like a touchscreen and front light, but delivers true pocketability. The X4 is available now for $69 from Xteinkâ€™s website. Chinese startup Xteink is after a spot in readersâ€™ pockets. Today, the brand introduced its newest device, the Xteink X4, a tiny and extremely affordable e-reader designed to snap onto the back of your phone. The device lacks some premium specs but offers a unique level of portability and a fantastic price tag. The X4 weighs just 74 grams and measures 114 Ã— 69 Ã— 5.9mm, making it roughly the footprint of a stack of credit cards. It features a 4.3-inch E Ink display rated at 220ppi, which is softer than the 300ppi panels found on most mainstream e-readers, but the X4 is meant for quick reading breaks rather than extended binge sessions.

items.title: Latest trademark suggests Starlink Mobile cellular service may be inevitable, but when?
items.summary: Combined with Musk's previous statements around the possibiliy, Starlink Mobile is likely coming someday. But when?
items.body: Credit: Andrew Grush / Android Authority TL;DR Starlink filed new trademarks, including â€œStarlink Mobileâ€ and â€œPowered by Starlinkâ€, covering cellular communication services and delivery of video and data to mobile devices. The filings follow Starlinkâ€™s growing telecom activity, including its T-Mobile satellite partnership and recent acquisition of terrestrial spectrum from EchoStar. None of this is too surprising, as Musk had previously stated that Starlink may eventually offer full cellular service, though he suggested it was likely a ways off at the time. Starlink has been transforming the way people connect to the internet for over six years now, and during that time the company has grown significantly in both subscribers and ambition. It initially focused on satellite ISP services, but in 2022 it announced a partnership with T-Mobile to provide satellite features for cellular subscribers as well. This collaboration eventually led to T-Satellite by Starlink , which offers limited connectivity in areas where cellular towers are unavailable. As first spotted by PC Mag , it now appears that a new trademark suggests Starlinkâ€™s mobile ambitions likely extend far beyond this. Donâ€™t â€¦

items.body: Credit: Rushil Agrawal / Android Authority TL;DR TicWatch models have largely vanished from Amazon and Mobvoiâ€™s website. Mobvoi said it has â€œno new information to announceâ€ but will keep existing watches on â€œessential support.â€ This could suggest that the brand that once helped prop up Wear OS is being phased out. Smartwatch fans may have spotted a notable omission from this yearâ€™s holiday sales. The Mobvoi TicWatch lineup has been a steady presence in the Wear OS world for years, but most of its watches seem to have slipped away from retailers without much fanfare. You canâ€™t currently buy them on either Amazon or Mobvoiâ€™s own website, which seems to be an ominous sign that the lineup is fading out. As reported by 9to5Google , all TicWatch listings on Amazon have essentially disappeared . On Mobvoiâ€™s site, the watches have been removed from the product listings, and even the odd ones that can be navigated to via banners lead to a notice stating that the product is unavailable when you click the buy button.

You can trigger it on a monitor by long-clicking the home or app drawer buttons. Circle to Search is one of Androidâ€™s most useful features, letting you quickly Google any text or image onscreen. It can translate text, identify songs, act as a game guide, and even warn you about potential scams. While Google has brought the feature to most premium Android phones since its debut, it has remained limited to their main, internal displays. Connect your phone to an external monitor, and youâ€™ll find the feature unaware of its existence â€” fortunately, Google has addressed this limitation in the latest Android update. Beyond what Google announced, users also reported that the update quietly restored the screen-off fingerprint unlock feature. items.title: Lower streaming prices in this economy? A Netflix and HBO Max bundle could make it so (Update)
items.summary: Netflix and Warner Bros Discovery have reached a deal.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Netflix is attempting to acquire Warner Bros Discoveryâ€™s studios and streaming unit. The proposed acquisition could see Netflix and HBO Max bundled together. If the bid is successful, it would reportedly lower the combined cost for consumers. Update: December 5, 2025 (10:43 AM ET): Netflix has announced that it has entered into a definitive agreement with Warner Bros Discovery to acquire WBDâ€™s film and television studios, HBO Max, and HBO. This means that shows and movies, including the DC Universe, The Big Bang Theory, The Sopranos, Game of Thrones, The Wizard of Oz, and more, will now be under the Netflix umbrella once the transaction is closed. In the announcement, Netflix states that it â€œexpects to maintain Warner Bros.â€™ current operations and build on its strengths, including theatrical releases for films.â€ The company also says, â€œBy adding the deep film and TV libraries and HBO and HBO Max programming, Netflix members will have even more high-quality titles from which to choose.â€ Netflix did not share how this development will affect its streaming prices.

items.title: OnePlus 15 overheating fix tested â€” here are the results
items.summary: A OnePlus 15 software update cools it down, but is it enough?
items.body: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wstz5TElzCo When we initially reviewed the new OnePlus 15 , we found that the phoneâ€™s Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 was too hot to complete our usual stress test benchmarks. At the time, OnePlus stated that it was â€œrefining the thermal curveâ€ and has since issued an update to the handset, claiming it has addressed the problem. So weâ€™ve updated our handset and re-run the tests to find out. Before conducting the stress tests, we re-ran the OnePlus 15 through GeekBench 6 to verify that the phoneâ€™s overall performance profile hadnâ€™t changed. The good news is that CPU performance remains just as good, if not marginally better (though a 1.5% to 2% improvement is within the margin of error) than before the update. Flicking on the phoneâ€™s performance mode is actually closer to 5% faster in multi-core.

items.title: Your Pixel phone can now be used as a webcam for the Nintendo Switch 2
items.summary: Want to use GameChat on the go without lugging around a USB camera? Use your Pixel phone as your Switch 2â€™s webcam!
items.body: TL;DR Google Pixel phones can now function as USB webcams for the Nintendo Switch 2â€™s GameChat feature. Early testing showed incompatibility issues between the two devices, but users confirm the connection now works seamlessly. This allows Pixel owners to join video calls on the console without needing to purchase or carry a separate webcam. One of the new social gaming features introduced with the Nintendo Switch 2 is GameChat, which essentially lets you join a group video call where everyone shares their game screen and camera feed. GameChat lets you see and chat with friends even if theyâ€™re playing different games, but it requires external hardware to show your face, as the Switch 2 lacks a built-in camera. Nintendo says the Switch 2 works with most USB webcams, but in our early testing, we found that it wasnâ€™t compatible with the Pixelâ€™s USB webcam mode. Fortunately, thatâ€™s no longer the case.

items.title: How to unlock Android Auto developer settings (and why you might want to)
items.summary: You can gain access to a few more useful Android settings in your car, but do you need them?
items.body: One of the first items I always enable when I get a new Android phone is developer mode. This hidden menu is designed to cater to the needs of developers, and it contains numerous valuable items for power users. I use it to increase the speed of animations, fit even more content on my screen , and enable wired and wireless debugging. But did you know that you can also enable Android Auto developer settings if you use the service in your car? Itâ€™s not as feature-filled as Android properâ€™s equivalent, but it still includes a few useful items that will enhance your overall smart driving experience. Itâ€™s one of the first Android Auto settings I tweak on a new car or phone.

With improved app icon customization, lock screen widgets , and more, QPR2 is a darn good update. One of the more interesting changes is actually a reversal of something added in Android 16 QPR1 this past September. As part of the Material 3 Expressive interface added to Pixel phones with that update, one of the bigger UI tweaks was a blur effect in the app drawer and Quick Settings panel. I donâ€™t mind it, but itâ€™s something a lot of Pixel users have wanted Google to get rid of.

items.title: This portable Google TV projector might be the perfect compromise for a secondary screen
items.summary: Big-screen views without big-deal setup.
items.body: I didnâ€™t expect the Epson Lifestudio Flex Plus to reinvent my home theater experience, but I did hope for an accessible setup. Most importantly, I wanted a solid option in time for holiday movie marathons. By the end of my review, Epsonâ€™s flagship portable Lifestudio projector over-delivered and then some, earning a permanent spot in my living room. On paper, itâ€™s a device with a clean look, built-in Google TV , and 3LCD tech for avoiding the rainbow artifacts common in lifestyle models. In practice, it not only lived up to its specs but also naturally slipped into everyday use.

items.body: A few months ago, I faced something that had never happened to me before: A trusty pair of Bluetooth earbuds died on me. No, itâ€™s not that they ran out of juice or that I lost my charging cable; they just flat-out stopped working. And, as someone with several weekends of fall travel coming up, that was going to be a problem. I knew Iâ€™d have to replace my trusty â€˜buds, and Iâ€™d have to do it reasonably quickly. So, I did what any well-informed shopper would do: I sought out the advice of experts. I pinged a few members of the SoundGuys crew and checked in with our own Rita El Khoury, whose gadget tastes often match my own. I gave them my budget, which wasnâ€™t much considering I was coming from the CMF Buds Pro 2 , and asked what they thought I should get next.

items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR Samsungâ€™s One UI 8.5 is expected to bring a major redesign for its system apps. Recent leaks point to redesigned Clock, Calculator, and Internet apps. The update brings a good dose of colors and 3D neomorphic effects. Samsungâ€™s One UI 8.5 has already been spoiled by extensive leaks, even before the official release or even a beta rollout. Based on these leaks, we know that Samsung is planning a significant visual overhaul with the update, including redesigned menus and transparency features seemingly inspired by Appleâ€™s latest iOS 26 update. In addition, Samsung is also expected to enhance app icons with 3D effects that might remind you of the bygone Touchwiz era . However, a more recent leak suggests these traits may not be limited just to app icons. With One UI 8.5, Samsung could add 3D neomorphic effects to various system apps. A series of recent leaks already indicated these changes are coming to the Clock, Calculator, and the Samsung Internet browser.

The Samsung Galaxy S26 series is expected to debut early next year, and one enduring rumor is that the phones will finally offer integrated magnets for wireless charging and accessories. Now, a trusted outlet has discovered an interesting Samsung accessory. WinFuture combed through retailer data and discovered that Samsung is working on a new magnetic wireless charging dock. The so-called Samsung Magnetic Wireless Charger has the model number EP-P2900 and offers 25W wireless charging speeds.

items.summary: Phreeli is a new US carrier that allows you to sign up with just a ZIP code.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority TL;DR A new MVNO called Phreeli allows you to sign up with only a ZIP code, which its founder claims is legal in all 50 states. It operates on T-Mobileâ€™s network, but does not store names, addresses, or payment details. Founder Nicholas Merrill says the goal is to break the link between a personâ€™s phone identity and their personal data. If youâ€™ve ever felt uneasy about how much your phone company knows about you, you might soon have a more private option. Nicholas Merrill is best known for fighting an FBI surveillance order for more than a decade. He has now launched Phreeli, a new mobile carrier that lets you sign up with nothing more than your ZIP code. As Wired reports, Phreeli (pronounced like â€˜freelyâ€™) runs on T-Mobileâ€™s network, but the real headline is what it refuses to collect. The company doesnâ€™t ask for your name, address, or any other information that could be linked to your phone number. Merrill states that the level of anonymity is legal in every US state, and the ZIP code is provided solely for tax purposes.

items.title: Find Hub gets a new boost as Google makes it part of the Android setup process
items.summary: You can now enroll your Android phone in Googleâ€™s Find Hub network when you set it up.
items.body: TL;DR Google is rolling out a new setup screen that encourages users to enable the more reliable tracking setting for its Find Hub network. This setting allows the network to use a single deviceâ€™s location data to find lost items, improving reliability in low-traffic areas. The new screen simplifies the options and explicitly warns that the default setting may make it harder to locate items in remote places. For most Android users, the best item tracking option is Googleâ€™s Find Hub , as it works on almost every Android device. There are even a variety of compatible Bluetooth trackers you can use to locate your items. Unfortunately, Find Hub can have trouble locating items in some areas due to its default configuration. Out of the box, the network requires multiple Android devices to detect an item before reporting its location, limiting reliability in low-traffic areas. While it looks unlikely that Google will reverse this decision soon, the company is starting to nudge users to enable the networkâ€™s more reliable tracking setting. items.title: Did the December Pixel update break some gesture input? Youâ€™re not alone
items.summary: Some users say a familiar swipe isnâ€™t behaving as expected in One-Handed Mode.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Some Pixel owners say the December update stopped the notification shade from opening normally in One-Handed Mode. Reports span several models, but others say theirs still works, so the issue isnâ€™t universal. Google hasnâ€™t documented any changes to One-Handed Mode; weâ€™ve reached out to the company for comment. A handful of Pixel owners claim that the December Pixel update may have inadvertently broken one of the commonly used gestures. Several online reports claim that the notification shade can no longer be pulled down once One-Handed Mode is active, a feature that was working normally before the latest update. The first report appeared on Googleâ€™s Pixel Support page , where a Pixel 9 Pro owner said they were suddenly unable to open the notification panel after triggering One-Handed Mode. Similar complaints then surfaced on Reddit here and here , with users on devices ranging from the Pixel 9 Pro to the Pixel 10 Pro XL reporting that the same gesture no longer works after the update.

items.title: 'No more Average Joe as Root century seals all-time great status'
items.summary: Joe Root finally hitting the elusive Test century in Australia proves his status as one of the all-time great batters, says chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt.

items.title: Sideloading apps on Android 16 QPR2 has a much nicer-looking UI
items.summary: The Package Installer has been redesigned in Android 16 QPR2 to use more modern design elements.
items.body: TL;DR Google has updated the Android Package Installer with the new Material 3 Expressive design language to match the rest of the OS. The redesigned dialog centers the app name and icon while using distinct filled and elevated button styles to improve usability. You will need to install the Android 16 QPR2 update to see the changes, as this component cannot be updated via Google Play System Updates. With the first quarterly release of Android 16 , Google completely revamped the operating systemâ€™s UI to introduce its new Material 3 Expressive design language. From the notification panel to the Settings app to the lock screen and beyond, Google redesigned nearly every system interface visible to the user. However, Android is a huge OS, so Google missed a few parts during the initial overhaul, such as the Package Installer that handles sideloading apps. With Androidâ€™s latest update, the Package Installer has finally received its Material 3 Expressive redesign, too. After receiving the Android 16 QPR2 update that rolled out the other day, developer Rob Wainwright discovered that Google redesigned the dialogs that appear when you install an app from outside the Play Store . The new laâ€¦

items.title: New Android malware sneak-wipes your bank account: Hereâ€™s how to avoid getting robbed
items.summary: See an offer too good to be true? It's straight road to a malware in disguise.
items.body: TL;DR Researchers have identified a new banking malware that replaces your actual banking app with a malicious one. It primarily spreads through APKs distributed via unmoderated channels such as messaging platforms. Once installed, the malware enables hackers to remotely control your device and hide their activities behind fake blank or update screens. Just last week, we learned about a banking malware that exploits accessibility settings on Android to steal your bank credentials in the background. Now, weâ€™re looking at another malware that not only enables remote attacks on Android devices but is distributed freely among hackers as part of a subscription service. Researchers at Cleafy , an online fraud prevention firm, have discovered (via MalwareBytes ) a new Android trojanware dubbed â€œAlbiriox.â€ Just like Sturnus, which we learned about last week, Albiriox is distributed through infected or dummy APKs by luring potential targets into believing they are downloading actual apps. One of the ways that hackers use to achieve that is by creating fake replicas of Google Play Store listings, making users believe they are downloading apps from secure sources when they are actually not. â€¦

items.title: Sony just gave its best noise-canceling headphones a sports makeover
items.summary: Sony turns the WH-1000XM5 into NFL fan gear, starting with the Detroit Lions.
items.body: Credit: Sony TL;DR Sony has turned its WH-1000XM5 into a limited-edition NFL lineup, starting with a Detroit Lions-themed model in a silver finish. The Lions Edition is available now for an early price of $330 (regularly $400). Meanwhile, the Buffalo Bills and Houston Texans versions are set to arrive on December 8 and 11, respectively. What happens when your favorite noise-canceling headphones meet NFL fandom? Sony just showed us by reworking its flagship WH-1000XM5 into a limited-edition NFL collection. The first to drop is a Detroit Lions model that slaps the teamâ€™s logo on an all-silver chassis, according to Sonyâ€™s post on Instagram . Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: You can finally force most apps to dark mode on your Pixel; hereâ€™s how
items.summary: Hello darkness, my old friend.
items.body: With Android QPR2 , which started rolling out a few days ago in early December, Google is bringing a slew of cool new features to Android â€” specifically its Pixel phones. One of these is a feature Iâ€™m sure many of you have been praying for: a forced dark mode that applies to most apps, even if they donâ€™t support a dark mode out of the box. The new feature is called Expanded dark mode , and hereâ€™s how you can enable it on your Pixel phone as well as a few examples of how it works.

items.title: Samsung could finally upgrade its rugged smartwatch with Galaxy Watch Ultra 2
items.summary: It could launch alongside the Galaxy Watch 9 and Galaxy Z Fold 8 lineup in summer next year.
items.body: Credit: Kaitlyn Cimino / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung is reportedly developing the Galaxy Watch Ultra 2 alongside the Galaxy Watch 9. Both smartwatches are expected to launch around July 2026 alongside Samsungâ€™s next foldables. Samsung expanded its smartwatch lineup with the launch of the Galaxy Watch Ultra, directly competing with the Apple Watch Ultra. Much like Apple, Samsung has barely refreshed the Galaxy Watch Ultra this year, giving it more storage and a new color, but nothing else. Are we in for another refresh next year? A new leak is giving us positive news, as it seems the Galaxy Watch Ultra 2 is in the works, and it could bring some upgrades. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: The vivo X300 Pro is a camera phone champ with a key weakness
items.summary: A full-featured, top-tier camera experience? Yep. Good global Android skin? Indeed. Long battery life? Well...
items.body: I love mobile cameras, and for the past year Iâ€™ve been enjoying taking snaps with the vivo X200 Pro . Between the fantastic camera zoom, variety of video capture options, and premium extras, there was a lot to like. The X200 Pro wasnâ€™t perfect, though. A weird glare issue on the primary camera, along with plenty of bloat, a dearth of AI features, and a ho-hum update pledge sullied the otherwise great package. Now, vivo has launched the X300 Pro, its next flagship phone for global markets. So does the new phone pick up the baton and run even faster, or does it stumble and fall in a heap? I took it for a spin for a few weeks to find out.

items.title: Emulating PC games on Android is easier than ever, and you can thank Valve
items.summary: A top engineer from Steam's maker reveals the company's contribution to mobile gaming.
items.body: Credit: Nick Fernandez / Android Authority TL;DR Steamâ€™s maker, Valve, has been playing a huge role in Windows emulation on Android. Valve has funded projects such as Fex emulator and Proton, which allow Windows games to run on Android more easily. Fex and Proton also form the basis for GameHub, a popular Windows emulator for Android. For nearly three decades, Valve Corp. has played an indispensable role in PC gaming, especially contributing to distribution and DRM rights for titles through Steam . But more recently, the company has been interested in making gaming more mobile, first with the launch of the Steam Deck and, more recently, with the Steam Machine , its PC-console hybrid for running Windows games, as well as the Steam Frame XR headset. However, in addition to contributing to PC gamingâ€™s portability, Valve might solve another problem: the uninspiring state of title support on Arm chips for laptops, including Appleâ€™s M series and Qualcommâ€™s Snapdragon X. And in doing so, the indirect benefactor will be the broader set of Arm devices, i.e., mobile phones and tablets. Sean Hollister of The Verge recently discussed Steam Hardwareâ€™s role in emulation on mobile devices, partiâ€¦

items.title: Youâ€™re probably not using these 7 Google Pixel camera settings, and thatâ€™s a mistake
items.summary: Your Pixel camera is a lot more capable than you think.
items.body: Iâ€™ve been a Google Pixel guy ever since the original Pixel was released in 2016. I love Pixels so much because of Googleâ€™s software design, excellent Pixel-exclusive features , and â€” of course â€” the cameras. The main draw to the Pixel camera experience is its simplicity. You take out your phone, press the shutter button, and youâ€™re all but guaranteed a good-looking photo. And as great as that simplicity is, there are also plenty of settings you can configure to customize the camera.

items.title: Google Fiâ€™s big RCS upgrade lands at last, with a small catch
items.summary: Google Fi splits web calls and texts to give you proper RCS.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google Fi finally makes web calling and RCS coexist. The fix comes with a trade-off: calling and messaging now live in two separate web portals. A new Web Calls page handles voice and voicemail, while RCS messaging shifts to Google Messages for Web. If youâ€™ve ever tried to manage calls or texts from your laptop with Google Fi and ended up frustrated, youâ€™re not alone. For quite a while, web-based calls and messaging didnâ€™t work well with RCS , but thatâ€™s starting to improve. Google has now rolled out a fix that lets you keep web calling features alongside modern RCS messaging, 9to5Google reports. However, the new solution still isnâ€™t as streamlined as many hoped.

items.title: Google finally listened! New gestures are coming to Pixel Watch (APK Teardown)
items.summary: Double-pinch and wrist turn gestures appear to be in the works for Google's smartwatches.
items.body: Credit: Adamya Sharma / Android Authority TL;DR Google appears to be working on new gestures for Pixel Watches. Weâ€™ve found clear code evidence suggesting Google is developing double-pinch and wrist-turn gestures for its smartwatches. Wrist gestures used to be a thing up until Wear OS 3, and Googleâ€™s version of double-pinch is identical to what Apple and Samsung offer on their respective watches. Pixel Watch users have been asking for better gesture controls for years, and it looks like Google is finally answering their call. Ever since the Pixel Watch 4 introduced Raise to Talk for summoning Gemini , users, including yours truly, have hoped Google would expand its capabilities into more intuitive wrist and finger-based controls. After all, wrist gestures were a thing in the early Android Wear era before being quietly dropped them during the transition to Wear OS. Meanwhile, rivals like Samsung and Apple have offered gestures such as double-tap/double-pinch, fist tap, and more for years now. Well, it looks like the Pixel Watch will finally catch up to its competition real soon.

items.title: Survey reveals Android 16 QPR2 is a huge hit with fans
items.summary: The new release cycle is a winner for most, but broken UWB and other issues are still annoying some owners.
items.body: Credit: Mishaal Rahman / Android Authority Google is switching up its release cycle with Android 16 . Instead of just one big update, we get another smaller update before the end of the year in the form of Android 16 QPR2 . While Pixel users are used to QPR releases, many of the features within are available for OEMs to bake into their own updates, so they donâ€™t have to wait until the Android 17 release. We asked users what they think about Android 16 QPR2, and it turns out that most people are loving the update. Our poll received close to 2,700 votes, and from this group of people, over 1,700 (representing ~64% of voters) consider it a huge update, and they love it. The good majority has good reason for it, too, as thereâ€™s plenty to love in the update.

items.title: This new phone has the biggest battery weâ€™ve ever seen in a foldable
items.summary: We've seen foldable phones with big batteries before, but this brand's first foldable takes the cake.
items.body: Credit: Nubia Japan TL;DR Nubia has launched the Nubia Fold, its first book-style foldable phone. The phone has a 6,560mAh battery, which is the largest battery weâ€™ve seen in a Fold device. The Nubia Fold is currently available in Japan, but thereâ€™s no word on a wider release. Weâ€™ve seen a few book-style foldable phones with big batteries in 2025, including devices from Google, HONOR, and vivo. However, an established manufacturer has just launched its first Fold device, and it also has the biggest battery weâ€™ve ever seen in a foldable. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: You can finally use lock screen widgets on your Pixel phone, hereâ€™s how
items.summary: Widgets have officially come for your lock screen.
items.body: Googleâ€™s Android 16 QPR2 update is here, and itâ€™s a pretty impressive one. This latest quarterly platform release comes with several user-facing changes, and one of the biggest among them is lock screen widgets. The Pixel Tablet was the first Pixel device to get lock screen widgets in September 2024, but until now, lock screen widgets havenâ€™t been available on Pixel phones. That finally changes with Android 16 QPR2.

items.title: Take my money: These are the 7 apps I gladly pay for every month
items.summary: They aren't cheap, though.
items.body: Credit: Rita El Khoury / Android Authority Iâ€™m not a big fan of the subscription economy. It seems like most apps are trying to get us to pay a monthly â€” or yearly â€” subscription these days, a stark contrast to the times when getting full access required a single purchase. While most of the apps I use are free, and I can live with the ads and the limited feature set that come with them, there are a few that I gladly pay for every month. These apps roughly cost me around $65 every month but make my life easier in many ways. They help me stay on top of my finances, keep me organized, and make sure I can relax after a long, hard day. They are well worth the money, so I have zero regrets.

items.title: One of Circle to Searchâ€™s key features is getting continuous scrolling on Pixels
items.summary: And, we cant wait for it to expand to other devices.
items.body: Credit: Tushar Mehta / Android Authority TL;DR The translation feature in Circle to Search now supports continuous scrolling. With Scroll and translate, you can continue to use your phone while it translates whatâ€™s on the screen. The feature has been limited to Samsung devices since it first launched in September, but is now rolling out to Pixel 6 and newer Pixel devices. Google started pushing the second quarterly Android 16 â€” QPR2 â€” update to the Pixel 6 and newer Pixels earlier this week. As with the first quarterly update, there is a significant emphasis on visual improvements . The Android QPR2 brings support for force-theming icons, a forced dark mode for apps that donâ€™t inherently support it, additional accessibility features for better screen visibility, and more. One more feature that may have flown under the radar is the improvements the update brings to Circle to Search, and particularly how it handles translations. Until now, if you had to use Circle to Search for translations, it required capturing a screen and then waiting for translations. However, the new update includes a â€œ Scroll and translate â€ option, allowing Circle to Search to translate text while you scrollâ€¦

items.title: The 38 Best Restaurants in Rome, According to a Best-Selling Local Cookbook Author
items.summary: Roman cuisine is a reflection of the city itself â€” layered, deeply rooted in tradition, and full of contrasts. After years of eating my way through Rome, Iâ€™ve found the best meals are shaped as much by history as the hands that prepare them. Family-run trattorias have served the cityâ€™s defining disâ€¦

items.title: These Are the 2025 Eater Award Winners
items.summary: An octopus tostada in Austin. A fried-to-order churro in LA. A plate of Bengali wedding chicken in Raleigh, North Carolina. These are just a few of the flavors that struck a chord with Eater editors in cities across the United States in 2025. The breadth and depth of this yearâ€™s Eater Award winnersâ€¦

items.title: Your Cookie Swap Table Needs This Savory Parmesan Cake
items.summary: Helen Goh, formerly the lead pastry developer at Yotam Ottolenghiâ€™s London restaurant empire, believes in the power of baking. In her latest cookbook, Baking and the Meaning of Life â€” Goh also co-authored two books with Ottolenghi, Sweet and Ottolenghi Comfort â€” she goes deep into the pure pleasureâ€¦

items.title: 'A fearless hero for hapless England' - Robin Smith obituary
